item.title: Jasprit Bumrah achieves historic ICC Rankings feat, equals all time Indian record - The Times of India
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah Achieves Historic ICC Rankings Feat, Matches All-Time Indian Record

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

Jasprit Bumrah, India‚Äôs leading fast bowler, has reached an impressive milestone in the ICC Men's Test Bowling Rankings with 904 rating points, equaling the highest rating ever achieved by an Indian bowler.

  • Bumrah's performance in Brisbane contributed to his elevation in the rankings, as he took 9 wickets for 94 runs, earning 14 rating points.
  • The record previously held by Ravichandran Ashwin has now been matched, and Bumrah has a chance to surpass it in the upcoming Melbourne Test.
  • Travis Head has moved closer to the top three in the ICC Men's Test Batting Rankings following recent outstanding performances.
  • Notable changes in men's rankings have occurred stemming from various matches across formats.
  • Other players like Kagiso Rabada, Josh Hazlewood, and Pat Cummins have also seen significant movements in their rankings.
‚ÄúJasprit Bumrah's outstanding performance has solidified his top position in the Test Bowling Rankings.‚Äù

The ongoing Test series is witnessing remarkable individual performances, significantly influencing player rankings across international cricket.

item.title: Arjun Tendulkar Achieves Key Career Milestone During Vijay Hazare Trophy - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Arjun Tendulkar Achieves Key Career Milestone During Vijay Hazare Trophy

Publication Date: November 13, 2024

Source: NDTV Sports

Arjun Tendulkar, the son of legendary cricketer Sachin Tendulkar, has completed 50 wickets in white-ball cricket during the ongoing Vijay Hazare Trophy. He achieved this milestone while playing for Goa.

  • Arjun went wicketless in the game against Haryana but took three wickets against Odisha.
  • He has a total of 51 wickets in 41 white-ball matches, including 24 in List A and 27 in T20 cricket.
  • Jasprit Bumrah and Ravindra Jadeja are also pursuing milestones in the fourth Test against Australia.
  • Bumrah is six wickets away from reaching 200 Test scalps, and Jadeja is seven wickets away from 600 international wickets.
‚ÄúBumrah is just six wickets away from achieving 200 Test scalps and becoming the 12th Indian bowler to do so.‚Äù

This milestone is significant for Arjun, showcasing his growth in the sport and following in his father's legendary footsteps.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah proving bigger threat than Hadlee, Ambrose, Holding, Kapil in Australia - The Times of India
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah Proving Bigger Threat Than Hadlee, Ambrose, Holding, Kapil in Australia

Date & Source: Not provided

Jasprit Bumrah has emerged as a formidable threat during India‚Äôs cricket tours in Australia, surpassing legendary bowlers and contributing significantly to India's success.

  • Bumrah has taken 21 wickets in three Tests of the ongoing Border Gavaskar Trophy at an average of 10.90.
  • He crossed 50 Test wickets in Australia, with a strike rate of 41.0, the best among his peers.
  • Historic series wins by India align with Bumrah's impressive performance during these tours.
  • He has taken two five-wicket hauls this tour, showcasing exceptional skill.
  • Bumrah's performance outshines cricket legends like Richard Hadlee and Curtly Ambrose, with statistics proving his dominance.
‚ÄúVirat Kohli is a modern-day great. He will figure it out.‚Äù - Rohit Sharma

In conclusion, Jasprit Bumrah's outstanding bowling against Australia has not only redefined standards but also potentially set new benchmarks in Test cricket.

item.title: Vinod Kambli develops fever as MRI procedure delayed, remains in ICU; doctor says condition 'stable' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Vinod Kambli develops fever as MRI procedure delayed, remains in ICU; doctor says condition 'stable'

Date: Dec 25, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Former Indian cricketer Vinod Kambli has been admitted to the ICU for treatment of a urinary tract infection and developed a fever on Tuesday. Doctors report his condition remains stable.

  • Kambli was admitted to ICU on Saturday for a severe urinary tract infection.
  • He is responding well to treatment, according to Dr. Vivek Trivedi.
  • His upcoming MRI procedure has been postponed due to a fever.
  • Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde offered financial support of ‚Çπ5 lakh for Kambli.
  • Kambli is expected to be moved out of ICU in a few days, with a likely discharge in about four days.
‚ÄúI want to personally meet the Deputy CM to thank him for his help during this difficult time.‚Äù ‚Äì Vinod Kambli

The medical team remains optimistic about Kambli's recovery, while his health continues to be closely monitored.

item.title: Vinod Kambli assured of Rs 5 lakh assistance by Shiv Sena - The Times of India
item.description:
Vinod Kambli Assured Rs 5 Lakh Assistance by Shiv Sena

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Former Indian cricketer Vinod Kambli has received a promise of Rs 5 lakh assistance from the Shiv Sena for his medical expenses, acknowledging his recent health challenges and the need for financial support.

  • Vinod Kambli has been facing health issues.
  • Shiv Sena has stepped in to provide financial aid.
  • This support is aimed at easing his medical expenses.
‚ÄúI appreciate the support from Shiv Sena during this challenging time.‚Äù

In conclusion, Kambli's situation has caught the attention of the public and his plea for help has led to this financial backing from Shiv Sena, showcasing community support for sports figures in need.

item.title: Ravichandran Ashwin uncovers Travis Head's clever 'ploy' to outsmart Jasprit Bumrah and co. - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Ravichandran Ashwin uncovers Travis Head's clever 'ploy' to outsmart Jasprit Bumrah and co.

Publication Date: Dec 25, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

Ravichandran Ashwin highlights Travis Head's strategic adjustments in batting drills to tackle Indian pacers ahead of the upcoming Boxing Day Test in Melbourne.

  • Ashwin shares insights into Head's batting practice aimed at addressing pacers bowling from around the wicket.
  • Head has been a key player for Australia, scoring over 400 runs in the series, including two centuries.
  • Head is coming off a series of impressive performances, significant for Australia's momentum after a recent win.
‚ÄúHead seemed to guard his off-stump to ensure he cleared a higher area around the off-stump to negate the round-the-wicket threat.‚Äù - Ravichandran Ashwin

Head's performance continues to stand out in the series amidst struggles from other Australian batters, underscoring his importance for the team's success.

item.title: Rohit Sharma To Open, India To Make Big Playing XI Change For 4th Australia Test: Report - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Rohit Sharma To Open, India To Make Big Playing XI Change For 4th Australia Test: Report

Date: December 24, 2024

Source: NDTV

Indian cricket team skipper Rohit Sharma is set to open the innings while KL Rahul will bat at No. 3 in the Boxing Day Test in Melbourne against Australia. Rohit will return as an opener after previously batting at No. 6, with uncertainty surrounding Shubman Gill's position.

  • Rohit Sharma confirmed to open the batting.
  • KL Rahul to bat at No. 3.
  • India may play two spinners, with Washington Sundar and Ravindra Jadeja potentially included.
  • Nitish Kumar Reddy may be dropped despite good performance in the series.
  • Mitchell Starc is on the verge of reaching 700 international wickets.
Mitchell Starc has taken 695 wickets in 284 matches, with 372 in Test matches alone.

This shift in lineup showcases India's strategy to tackle the Australian bowling attack effectively, especially during a critical match.

item.title: India have all but foiled Australia's 'smart-scheduling' plan - The Times of India
item.description:
India Have Foiled Australia's Scheduling Strategy in Border Gavaskar Trophy

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

This article discusses how India has countered Australia‚Äôs strategic scheduling in the Border Gavaskar Trophy, showcasing noteworthy performances and pivotal moments throughout the series.

  • Australia's scheduling aimed to leverage fast pitches to gain an early lead in the series.
  • India's Jasprit Bumrah has excelled, taking 21 wickets at an impressive average of 10.90.
  • Despite a strong start from India, Australian tactics have affected the morale of Indian batters.
  • Virat Kohli delivered a solid performance, with specific reference to his century in the second innings at Perth.
  • Looking ahead, the focus will be on the last two Tests in Melbourne and Sydney.
Rohit Sharma: 'Virat Kohli is a modern day great. He will figure it out'

In conclusion, while Australia initially had the scheduling advantage, India's strong bowling performance led by Bumrah and crucial batting efforts have put the series in a competitive light as they approach the final matches.

item.title: PV Sindhu-Venkata Datta Sai wedding reception: Chiranjeevi, Nagarjuna, Ajith, Mrunal Thakur attend. Watch - The Indian Express
item.description:
PV Sindhu-Venkata Datta Sai wedding reception: Chiranjeevi, Nagarjuna, Ajith, Mrunal Thakur attend

Publication Date: December 24, 2024

Source: Indian Express

The article covers the grand wedding reception held for PV Sindhu, an ace badminton player, and her husband Venkata Datta Sai after their intimate marriage in Udaipur. The reception was attended by numerous celebrities from the film industry.

  • PV Sindhu married Venkata Datta Sai in Udaipur before hosting a grand reception in Hyderabad.
  • Prominent guests included Ajith Kumar, Chiranjeevi, Nagarjuna, and Mrunal Thakur.
  • Ajith Kumar was praised for his stylish appearance at the event.
  • Nagarjuna and Chiranjeevi also sported fashionable outfits, with Chiranjeevi wearing a blue shirt and white pants.
  • PV Sindhu shared wedding photos on social media with heartfelt captions.
‚ÄúCongratulations üíê‚Äù ‚Äì Team Chiru, on Twitter

In summary, the wedding reception marked a significant celebration for the newlyweds, showcasing their friendship with various stars and their impactful presence in the entertainment industry.

item.title: Cummins wants Konstas to play like 'you're a kid in the backyard' on Boxing Day debut - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Cummins Encourages Konstas to Enjoy His Boxing Day Test Debut

Publication Date: December 25, 2023 | Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Australia captain Pat Cummins has urged Sam Konstas to embrace the youthful spirit during his Test debut against India, scheduled for Boxing Day at the MCG, in front of an expected crowd of over 90,000.

Cummins shared insights from his own debut experience, encouraging Konstas to play freely and enjoy the moment.

  • Cummins recalls his debut at 18, feeling less pressure due to his youth.
  • He emphasizes the importance of naivety and playing like a kid in the backyard.
  • Konstas will make his debut as Australia‚Äôs second youngest men's Test player.
  • Travis Head is fit to play after a successful fitness test.
  • Scott Boland returns to the squad in place of the injured Josh Hazlewood.
‚ÄúThe message to Sam... just enjoy the moment.‚Äù - Pat Cummins

With strong support from friends and family, Konstas is set to make a memorable debut, looking to follow in Cummins' footsteps.

item.title: Rohit Sharma to open, KL Rahul at No.3 in place of Shubman Gill; Washington Sundar to return in India's XI: Reports - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Rohit Sharma to Open, KL Rahul at No.3 in India's Boxing Day Test

Date: Dec 25, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

India is making significant changes to their batting lineup for the Boxing Day Test against Australia, with Rohit Sharma returning to the opening position alongside Yashasvi Jaiswal and KL Rahul moving to No.3.

  • Rohit Sharma will open alongside Yashasvi Jaiswal.
  • KL Rahul replaces Shubman Gill at No.3.
  • Sundar may return to the squad, possibly replacing Nitish Reddy or Akash Deep.
  • Rohit has struggled in the middle order in recent games, prompting the switch.
  • The series is currently tied at 1-1, making this Test crucial for the ICC World Test Championship.
‚ÄúLet‚Äôs not worry about who bats where. Something that we need to figure and not something I would be discussing here. We will do what is best for the team,‚Äù Rohit Sharma commented.

The changes in the batting order highlight India's strategy to enhance performance as they seek an advantageous position in the Test series.

item.title: ‚ÄúThey‚Äôre the idiots who picked an 18-year-old‚Äù - Pat Cummins backs bold selection call for BGT 2024-25 4th Test - Sportskeeda
item.description:
‚ÄúThey‚Äôre the idiots who picked an 18-year-old‚Äù - Pat Cummins backs bold selection call for BGT 2024-25 4th Test

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Sportskeeda

Australia skipper Pat Cummins has endorsed Sam Konstas, a 19-year-old cricketer, encouraging him to play with freedom in the crucial fourth Test against India in Melbourne. The series is tied at 1-1 after the first two tests.

  • Cummins criticized previous selection of Nathan McSweeney, who struggled in the first three Tests.
  • He emphasized that young players should not feel pressured and can enjoy the game without inhibitions.
  • Kahnsas has shown promise with recent domestic performances, scoring a century and two half-centuries in his last four innings.
‚ÄúI think you always want to do well (but) I was saying this to Sam the other day, I remember that as an 18-year-old... it‚Äôs Boxing Day. It doesn‚Äôt get any better than this, so just enjoy the moment.‚Äù

item.title: IND vs AUS: Rohit Sharma likely to open in Boxing Day Test vs Australia at MCG - The Times of India
item.description:
Rohit Sharma Set to Open in Boxing Day Test Against Australia

Date: December 25, 2024 | Source: Times of India

Indian captain Rohit Sharma is likely to open the batting for India in the upcoming Boxing Day Test against Australia at the MCG, affecting KL Rahul's position in the batting order.

  • Rohit Sharma is expected to return to the top of the order in the Test starting on Thursday.
  • KL Rahul will move to the No.3 slot in batting order.
  • Rohit is coming off a series of underwhelming performances but is ready to contribute.
  • The weather conditions in Melbourne are unpredictable, potentially influencing team strategy regarding spinners.
  • The series is currently tied at 1-1, making this a crucial match for both teams.
‚ÄúLet‚Äôs not worry about who bats where. Something that we need to figure and not something I would be discussing here. We will do what is best for the team.‚Äù - Rohit Sharma

This Test will be pivotal for India, with a large crowd expected, as they aim to gain an advantage in the closely contested series.

item.title: Vinod Kambli health concerns: From brain clots, heart ailments to urine infection, what all is affecting former cricketer - India.com
item.description:
Vinod Kambli health concerns: From brain clots, heart ailments to urine infection, what all is affecting former cricketer

Publication Date: Unavailable - Source: India.com

Former cricketer Vinod Kambli is facing multiple health issues, including brain clots, heart ailments, and a urinary infection. This summary explores the extent of his medical challenges and their impact on his life.

  • Kambli has been diagnosed with brain clots causing significant health concerns.
  • Heart ailments have exacerbated his overall health condition.
  • Recent reports indicate a urinary infection that requires treatment.
"Health is wealth, and it is something we often take for granted until it is at stake."

The array of health issues facing Vinod Kambli highlights the importance of regular health check-ups and a healthy lifestyle.

item.title: PV Sindhu and Venkata Sai‚Äôs wedding reception held in Hyderabad - The Hindu
item.description:
PV Sindhu and Venkata Sai‚Äôs Wedding Reception in Hyderabad

Date: December 25, 2024

Source: The Hindu

The wedding reception of champion shuttler P.V. Sindhu and Datta Venkata Sai, CEO of Posidex Technologies, was held in Hyderabad on December 24, 2024. They got married in Udaipur, Rajasthan on December 22, 2024.

  • PV Sindhu's wedding reception was attended by notable figures including Telangana Chief Minister A. Revanth Reddy and Governor Jishnu Dev Varma.
  • The event was grand, with many prominent personalities from various sectors in attendance.
  • Sindhu shared photos of her marriage on social media.
‚ÄúPV Sindhu's wedding reception held in Hyderabad‚Äù

This event marks a significant celebration for the renowned badminton player and showcases her prominence as a personality in Indian sports.

item.title: Australia Name Playing XI For Boxing Day Test Against India, Make 2 Huge Changes - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Australia Names Playing XI for Boxing Day Test Against India

Date: December 25, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Australia has announced their playing XI for the Boxing Day Test match against India, which starts on Thursday, featuring two significant changes to the lineup.

  • Scott Boland replaces the injured Josh Hazlewood.
  • Teenager Sam Konstas will debut, taking Nathan McSweeney's place.
  • Travis Head has recovered from a minor thigh strain and is fit to play.
‚ÄúTrav is good to go, so he will play. No stress, no worries about injury for Trav.‚Äù - Pat Cummins

The five-match series is currently tied 1-1, following a win for India and a decisive victory for Australia.

item.title: "I Am MVP Of My Cricket, Not Rohit Sharma Or Virat Kohli": Ravichandran Ashwin - NDTV Sports
item.description:
I Am MVP Of My Cricket, Not Rohit Sharma Or Virat Kohli: Ravichandran Ashwin

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Ravichandran Ashwin, after his retirement from international cricket, emphasizes the significance of the team sport over individual accolades. He reflects on the perceptions surrounding his personality in cricket and asserts his self-worth as the MVP in his own cricketing journey.

  • Ashwin announced his retirement, receiving widespread tributes.
  • He interacts with former England captains Atherton and Hussain to discuss cricketing myths.
  • Ashwin aims to shed light on misconceptions about his seriousness on the field.
  • He emphasizes the unique journeys of individual players and asserts his place as MVP of his own cricket story.
‚ÄúIn my life, for my dad or for my mom, I am the MVP. It's not Rohit, Virat or somebody on the outside.‚Äù

Ashwin‚Äôs reflections invite a broader appreciation of all players in cricket, championing the idea that every individual's journey is unique and valuable.

item.title: All pace and no spin? Selection dilemma follows Pakistan to Centurion - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Pakistan's Selection Challenge Ahead of Test Match in Centurion

Publication Date: December 25, 2023 | Source: ESPNcricinfo

The Pakistan cricket team faces a critical selection dilemma as they prepare for their upcoming Test match in Centurion, contrasting with their recent experience in Rawalpindi where they struggled without a specialist spinner.

  • The weather in Centurion has improved to a crisp summer breeze, differing greatly from the hot conditions in Rawalpindi.
  • Pakistan is evaluating their team composition for the Boxing Day Test, particularly whether to include a specialist spinner.
  • Recent history shows a tactical misstep for Pakistan when they fielded an all-pace attack against Bangladesh, leading to defeat.
  • South Africa also seems likely to field an all-pace attack due to fitness concerns over spinner Keshav Maharaj.
  • Key player Saud Shakeel emphasized the need for careful consideration before finalizing the squad.

‚ÄúThe pitch looks like it has a lot of moisture, but there's a couple of days left still before the start of the Test, so let's see how the pitch looks then.‚ÄùSaud Shakeel

The decision on team composition is critical, as past experiences illustrate the risks involved with misjudging pitch conditions, making the selection process both urgent and high-stakes.

item.title: Ajith Kumar, Chiranjeevi, Nagarjuna, Mrunal Thakur attend PV Sindhu-Venkata Datta Sai's wedding reception. Watch - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Celebrities Attend PV Sindhu's Wedding Reception with Venkata Datta Sai

Date: Dec 25, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

P.V. Sindhu married businessman Venkata Datta Sai in Udaipur, followed by a grand wedding reception in Hyderabad attended by numerous film celebrities.

  • Ajith Kumar attended looking sharp in a black suit.
  • Nagarjuna and Chiranjeevi were also present, showcasing their stylish looks.
  • Mrunal Thakur dazzled in a beautiful lehenga at the reception.
P.V. Sindhu shared wedding photos on social media, captioning them with a heart emoji.

The event celebrated love and celebrity camaraderie, highlighting the joy surrounding Sindhu's new journey.

item.title: "I am the MVP and not Rohit, Virat": Ravichandran Ashwin speaks up against the trend of labelling other players as support cast - Crictoday
item.description:
‚ÄúI am the MVP and not Rohit, Virat‚Äù: Ravichandran Ashwin speaks up against the trend of labelling other players as support cast

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Crictoday

Ravichandran Ashwin, the second-highest wicket-taker for India, has voiced his concerns over the labeling of players as support cast, stressing the importance of recognizing every player‚Äôs contribution in cricket as a team sport.

  • Ashwin took 765 wickets for India across formats.
  • He criticized the narrative that sidelines players like him in favor of star players like Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma.
  • Ashwin declared himself the 'MVP' of his own career, highlighting the personal significance of this title for him and his family.
  • Despite retiring from international cricket, Ashwin will continue his career with Chennai Super Kings in the IPL.
‚ÄúI am the MVP in my life. For my mom and dad, I am the MVP. It is not Rohit, Virat or somebody as everyone‚Äôs journey is unique.‚Äù

Ashwin's statements bring attention to the broader discourse around the narrative of cricket, advocating for recognition of all players‚Äô vital roles in the sport.

item.title: Vinod Kambli 'Stable' After Major Health Scare, Receives Rs 5 Lakh Aid From... - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Vinod Kambli 'Stable' After Major Health Scare, Receives Rs 5 Lakh Aid

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Former India cricketer Vinod Kambli is recovering in the ICU after being hospitalized for a urinary tract infection. His condition is now stable, and he has received financial aid for his treatment.

  • Kambli was admitted to Akruti Hospital with a severe urinary tract infection.
  • His condition was critical four days prior due to pus accumulation in his bladder, which was removed upon hospitalization.
  • Doctors are planning an MRI to investigate brain clots after medical examinations.
  • Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde, along with his MP-son Shrikant Shinde, provided assistance of Rs 5 lakh for Kambli's medical expenses.
Kambli expressed heartfelt gratitude to the state's leadership for their support during his health crisis.

Kambli's health is being closely monitored, and he may be discharged within a few days as he continues to recover.

item.title: Boxing Day Test: Will Rohit Sharma and Usman Khawaja, Shubman Gill and Rishabh Pant, finally stand up? - The Indian Express
item.description:
Why is Boxing Day Test not a sacred tradition, but reflects power of marketing and Kerry Packer

Publication Date: December 25, 2023

Source: Indian Express

In Melbourne City, the festive atmosphere is vibrant as people prepare for the Boxing Day Test, yet beneath the excitement lies the truth: this event is shaped by marketing rather than tradition. Dr. Thomas Heenan from Monash University explains how the Boxing Day Test gained prominence only after Kerry Packer revolutionized cricket broadcasts.

  • The Boxing Day Test has become a staple of Australian culture but lacks historical tradition.
  • It was only after 1979, with Kerry Packer acquiring broadcast rights, that the event surged in popularity.
  • Initially, the day was reserved for other cricketing events, with minimal attendance until marketing strategies changed public perception.
  • The significance of Australia's historical oppponents, such as the West Indies and England, has evolved with the growing presence of Indian players.
  • Current team performance raises questions on batsmen's capabilities, highlighted by rookie challenges and pitch conditions.
‚ÄúBoxing Day Test is a perfect example of the power of marketing,‚Äù says Dr Thomas Heenan.

This reflection on the Boxing Day Test reveals how cultural events can be crafted through marketing, showing that traditions can be shaped in modern times rather than handed down through generations.

item.title: Boxing Day Test: Are India ready to make changes to ensure spearhead Jasprit Bumrah gets reinforcement? - The Times of India
item.description:
Boxing Day Test: Are India ready to make changes to ensure spearhead Jasprit Bumrah gets reinforcement?

Date: MELBOURNE

Source: Times of India

As India prepares for a critical fourth Test against Australia, discussions are underway regarding potential changes to their lineup to better support pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah. The team is contemplating the introduction of an additional pacer or spinner based on pitch conditions.

  • The Indian team is considering playing an extra pacer in light of pitch conditions favoring fast bowlers.
  • Rohit Sharma acknowledges the team's reliance on Bumrah's exceptional form.
  • Nitish Kumar Reddy‚Äôs dual role as a lower-order batter and occasional medium-pacer is under scrutiny.
  • Rohit spoke about the challenges of utilizing their current squad effectively given their players' form.
"It's a challenge to handle not just the bowling but the entire team. When somebody is in form, we have to make the most of that." - Rohit Sharma

The outcome of this decision may play a pivotal role in determining the success of the series for India.

item.title: Head declared fit as Australia pick eleven for Boxing Day Test - Cricbuzz
item.description:
Travis Head Declared Fit for Boxing Day Test as Australia Finalizes XI

Published on: Wed, Dec 25, 2024, 02:12 AM | Source: Cricbuzz

Travis Head has been officially passed fit for the Boxing Day Test against India at the MCG, with Australia making changes to their playing XI.

  • Head experienced a minor quad strain but has been cleared to play.
  • Sam Konstas will debut, and Scott Boland returns to the squad.
  • Captain Pat Cummins expressed confidence in Head's fitness and form.
  • Konstas is set to become the youngest Test opener for Australia at 19.
Australia XI: Usman Khawaja, Sam Konstas, Marnus Labuschagne, Steve Smith, Travis Head, Mitch Marsh, Alex Carey (wk), Pat Cummins (C), Mitchell Starc, Nathan Lyon, Scott Boland

Konstas replaces Nathan McSweeney, who was dropped after poor performances. Boland returns after a calf injury sidelined Josh Hazlewood.

item.title: Rohit Sharma Left Irritated By Fan's 'Shubman Gill' Request During Practice. His Reply... - NDTV Sports
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.
